items.title: Sultana accuses Corbyn of 'baseless' character attacks
items.excerpt: Former Labour MP Zarah Sultana has accused Jeremy Corbyn and other members of a new left-wing party of "baseless attacks" on her character and said she is consulting lawyers.

items.title: South Carolina lawmakers haven't been paid after one of their own sued over raise
items.excerpt: South Carolina legislators are not getting paid for the rest of the year over a lawsuit about a recent pay raise

items.title: Opponents prosper with divided unionism, says DUP leader
items.excerpt: The leader of the Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) has told his annual conference "when unionism is divided, our opponents prosper".

items.title: Lib Dems want to use wartime powers to clear asylum backlog
items.excerpt: The government should use emergency wartime powers to clear the asylum backlog and reduce the use of hotels, the Liberal Democrats have said.

items.title: Lib Dems reject debate on blocking trans women from diversity quotas
items.excerpt: A bid to remove trans women from Liberal Democrat diversity quotas has been blocked by party members at their annual conference.

items.title: Commons open to espionage after China spying charges dropped, says Speaker
items.excerpt: The Speaker of the Commons has said the decision to drop charges against two men accused of spying for China could leave Parliament vulnerable to espionage.

items.title: Under pressure to police comments on Kirk, colleges walk a tightrope on free speech
items.excerpt: Colleges around the country are under intense pressure to police insensitive comments about the assassination of Charlie Kirk, which leaves them with no easy choices

items.title: SNP  minister Jamie Hepburn resigns after assault claim
items.excerpt: Scottish government minister Jamie Hepburn has resigned after he was accused of physically assaulting the Conservative MSP Douglas Ross.

items.title: Reform councillor suspended for alleged PM threats
items.excerpt: A Reform UK councillor has been suspended from the party following allegations he made online comments threatening to kill the prime minister.

items.title: Political parties trade blame for potential shutdown
items.excerpt: Republicans and Democratic lawmakers show no signs of budging as the House takes up a bill to avert a partial government shutdown in less than two weeks

items.title: Phillipson suggests two-child benefit cap could be lifted
items.excerpt: Bridget Phillipson has said scrapping the two-child benefit cap is "on the table", in the clearest sign yet that ministers could scrap the policy.

items.title: More than 400 arrests made in Chicago area operation so far, top immigration official says
items.excerpt: Immigration and Customs Enforcement officials have arrested over 400 people in the Chicago area as part of an operation that began less than two weeks ago

items.title: Mixed reaction to UK-Ireland Troubles legacy deal
items.excerpt: Victims' families, campaigners and politicians have given a mixed response to a new framework aimed at addressing Northern Ireland Troubles legacy cases.

items.title: Despite another loss, Dolphins showed fight against the Bills, which could help avoid further spiral
items.excerpt: Dolphins receiver Jaylen Waddle opened the celebrations by hauling in a touchdown pass from Tua Tagovailoa and breaking out his signature penguin waddle

items.title: Bills running back James Cook is already validating his new contract 3 weeks into the season
items.excerpt: Buffalo Bills running back James Cook might be due for another raise

items.title: Assisted dying bill moves one step closer to becoming law
items.excerpt: The assisted dying bill has passed its second reading in the House of Lords, moving it another step closer to becoming law.

items.title: Rudy Giuliani is ordered to pay $1.36 million in legal bills
items.excerpt: It’s another blow to Rudy Giuliani’s withered wallet: A judge has ordered the former New York City mayor to pay $1.36 million in legal fees he racked up during investigations into his efforts to overturn President Donald Trump’s 2020 election loss

items.title: House turns back effort to censure Rep. Ilhan Omar over remarks about Charlie Kirk
items.excerpt: The House declined late Wednesday to punish one of its own over commentary in the aftermath of Charlie Kirk’s assassination

items.title: Harris says Buttigieg was her 'first choice' for 2024 running mate but the pairing was too risky
items.excerpt: In an excerpt of former Vice President Kamala Harris's new book, she says she would have picked Pete Buttigieg as her running mate last year but America wasn’t ready for the pairing

items.title: Trump's call to end mail-in voting creates a dilemma for GOP
items.excerpt: President Donald Trump has vowed to do away with voting by mail, but some of his Republican allies in battleground Arizona are taking a more cautious approach
